titles.title: There Is No Name So Sweet On Earth

authors.author: George W. Bethune William B. Bradbury

verse.name: c1a
verse.lines:
We love to sing of Christ our King
And hail Him blessed Jesus;

verse.name: c1b
verse.lines:
For there's no word ear ever heard,
So dear, so sweet as Jesus.

verse.name: v1a
verse.lines:
There is no name so sweet on earth,
No name so sweet in heaven;

verse.name: v1b
verse.lines:
The name before His wondrous birth,
To Christ the Savior given.

verse.name: v2a
verse.lines:
And when He hung upon the tree,
They wrote this name above Him;

verse.name: v2b
verse.lines:
That all might see the reason we,
For evermore must love Him.

verse.name: v3a
verse.lines:
So now upon His Father's throne,
Almighty to release us;

verse.name: v3b
verse.lines:
From sin and pain He ever reigns,
The Prince and Savior Jesus.

verse.name: v4a
verse.lines:
O Jesus, by that matchless name,
Thy grace shall fail us never;

verse.name: v4b
verse.lines:
Today as yesterday the same,
Thou art the same forever.
